name: Meagre's Reach
tagline: Antiquated village dredged out of time by Ygraine's sorcery
description: A quaint village of antique brick structures built tall and too close to one another. Meagre's Reach (or, as locals call it, simply "the Reach") is located close to several rich claybeds and thrives on clay mining and brickmaking.
atmosphere: A village caught between past and present, with temporal anomalies and growing unrest between rebels and loyalists
inhabitants_description: A noticeably aged population of folk native to the village, alongside a number of outsiders hired to work in the clay pits and brickworks

governance.ruling_body: council of Elders, dominated by Reynold Barhaim and Benedict Redhearth
governance.political_status: virtually independent, under patronage of Ygraine Mordlin
governance.notes: House Guillefer pays little attention to the village. Practically run by council of Elders under patronage of Ygraine Mordlin of nearby Chateau Mauvesse

religious_buildings: The Chapel of the Host of Heaven's Light
religion.religious_practices: Native Reach-folk are devout adherents of the Pluritine Church, but have a preference for private contemplation, scriptural study, and prayer in their own homes. The village's church is little used.

history: 250 years ago, it was ravaged by plague and became a ghost town, entirely abandoned
100 years later, Ygraine took up residence in the nearby Chateau Mauvesse
Ygraine worked great magic to give its people a second chance. The village as it existed 300 years ago—before the plague—was wrested out of time and brought into the present day
current_events: Unrest is brewing in Meagre's Reach, as the two most influential Elders vie for control
Benedict Redhearth believes that Ygraine keeps the village enchanted as a plaything and wishes to break free of her sorcerous yoke
Reynold Barhaim remains loyal to Ygraine, opposing Redhearth and his rebels. In secret, Barhaim is training his workers as a militia to resist Redhearth's rebels
rumors_reference: See Rumours in Meagre's Reach, p449

special_features.name: The Curse of Meagre's Reach
special_features.description: Any person born in Meagre's Reach cannot leave hex 1703. Those who pass outside the hex disappear into oblivion.
special_features.mechanical_effect: Natives cannot leave hex 1703 without disappearing

special_features.name: Elders and Younglings
special_features.description: The resurrected villagers (Elders) age at one-third of the normal rate due to temporal magic side-effects. Those born since resurrection (Younglings) age normally.

special_features.name: The Frozen
special_features.description: Three villagers stand frozen in time in the village square—victims of a flaw in Ygraine's magic. They are impervious to weathering and damage.
special_features.mechanical_effect: Completely frozen in time, impervious to damage

equipment_availability.notes: Armour, weapons, vehicles, and mounts cost 50% more than usual

locations.name: Village Square
locations.description: A tidy, brick-paved square whose breadth feels diminished by the overhanging eaves of the teetering buildings that surround it.
locations.exterior: Brick-paved square surrounded by tall, overhanging buildings
locations.populace: Village bustle, plus three frozen individuals
locations.atmosphere: Busy but diminished by looming architecture
special_features: The Frozen - three villagers frozen in time
Eggfast market and sermons by Benedict Redhearth
secrets: The Frozen are victims of Ygraine's flawed magic

locations.name: The Chapel of the Host of Heaven's Light
locations.description: A narrow church whose sober grey stone contrasts against the colourful brickwork of the rest of the village. Gargoyles in the form of puff-cheeked, goggle-eyed devils and priests festoon its exterior, also at ground level.
locations.interior: A poky space crammed with pews, candle holders, incense burners, stacks of prayer books, and far too many pillars. A beautiful wooden idol of St Lillibeth of the Sugared Breath stands upon the altar, depicted with a dozen doves perched among her cascading, gilded locks.
locations.exterior: Grey stone with gargoyles, inconspicuous 5' high oaken door
locations.populace: A small number of Younglings and the occasional traveller. 2-in-6 chance of the sage Lorrima Gravesby in prayer. Sister Delora observes stoically.

services.name: Prayer blessing
services.description: Characters praying may receive the blessing of St Lillibeth: the ability to cast Lesser Healing

special_features: Wooden idol of St Lillibeth of the Sugared Breath

locations.name: Redhearth Bakery
locations.description: The village bakery is notable for the vividly painted, life-size statue of St Hollyhock (patron saint of bakers' ovens) integrated into its exterior at ground level.
locations.interior: A cramped room stuffed with baskets. The heat and clouds of flour dust are nigh unbearable. The baker, Benedict Redhearth, furiously shovels fresh buns out of the oven and into baskets.
locations.exterior: Life-size statue of St Hollyhock with soot-covered face and hands, clutching a basket overflowing with scones. Two doors flank the statue.

services.name: Baked goods
services.notes: Only if caught in pleasant mood, limited opening hours

locations.name: Everslumber Lane
locations.description: A narrow lane lined with family crypts, the arch around each door decorated with human skulls. Within each crypt are interred the bones of many generations of Reach-folk, who do not bury their dead in the ground like other folk of Dolmenwood.
locations.interior: Family crypts containing bones of many generations
locations.exterior: Narrow lane with skull-decorated crypt doors
special_features: Names and dates carved on doors reveal gap in deaths between 250-100 years ago
secrets: The missing years reveal the time when the village was abandoned due to plague

locations.name: The Grizzle and Grouse
locations.description: A tall, narrow building on the edge of the village, constructed of purple-glazed bricks with an iridescent sheen. A grinning man in the moon face is engraved in each brick.
locations.interior: Smoky, dimly lit, and low-beamed, with tables crammed into odd nooks and corners. A magnificent pair of stuffed grouse is poised dramatically above the bar, the landlord, Primulus Paste, serving dourly beneath.
locations.exterior: Purple-glazed iridescent bricks with man in the moon faces, sign showing man in moon weeping into porridge bowl
locations.populace: A rowdy assortment of local Reach-folk and immigrant brick-workers. A group of Redhearth's Rebels invariably occupies a shadowed corner table, conspiring quietly.

services.name: Stoggy stew
services.description: Fermented game fowl served on a plate of beans—a local speciality

special_features: Evening entertainment with Betsy playing fiddle and forcing guests to dance duets
secrets: Redhearth's Rebels meet here and may approach outsiders for recruitment

locations.name: Smarg's Turret
locations.description: A square, four-storey turret, complete with crenellations, standing utterly incongruously at the edge of the village, under the boughs of a mighty copper beech. The origin of the turret and the identity of Smarg are unclear, even to Elders, but it is commonly believed to be the remnant of a much larger fortification.
locations.interior: Pristine, whitewashed walls, simple yet beautiful wooden furnishings, and meticulously ordered bookshelves (folklore and bestiaries) lining the spiral stairways. A silver Holy Shield bearing the symbol of St Signis hangs in the library on the second floor.
locations.exterior: Square four-storey turret with crenellations under copper beech, reinforced wooden door with brass Chapes holy symbol
locations.populace: The sage Lorrima Gravesby and 3 lichhounds named Benester, Eggort, and Hollyhock

services.name: Sage consultation
services.notes: Apply standard rules for hiring a sage

special_features: Expansive cellars contain jarred and stuffed specimens of fairies, monsters, and fantastic beasts
Silver Holy Shield of St Signis in library
secrets: Origin of turret and identity of Smarg unknown even to Elders

locations.name: Barhaim and Sons Brickyard
locations.description: A broad, dusty fenced yard, with towering piles of stacked bricks and a bustle of carts, draft horses, and whistling brick-workers.
locations.interior: Workers' lodgings with warehouse ground floor and rows of bunks on upper floors
locations.exterior: Fenced yard with brick piles, three kilns operating day and night, raised observation platform
locations.populace: Mix of locals and migrant workers from other parts of Dolmenwood. Reynold Barhaim and his five sons observe from raised platform.

services.name: Bricks
services.description: Clay bricks from local pits and Dark Mirror

secrets: Muffled sounds of military drills from basement at night - Barhaim training militia

locations.name: Follyegg Road
locations.description: A twisting, little-used road in the deep forest, leading west to the village of Odd (hex 1403).

locations.name: Mirror Road
locations.description: Paved with violet-glazed bricks, shimmering as though always cast in the light of an unobscured sunset, falling only into darkness when the moon is high. The Mirror Road leads four miles directly to the gates of Chateau Mauvesse (hex 1802), home of Ygraine the Sorceress.
locations.exterior: Violet-glazed brick road with supernatural sunset shimmer
locations.populace: Travelers to and from Chateau Mauvesse
special_features: Shimmers like sunset light except when moon is high

npcs.name: Reynold Barhaim
npcs.title: Brickmaster
npcs.description: A hearty, middle-aged human man of 115 years (as an Elder, he was born 315 years ago) with a bald pate and luxuriantly curled black beard and eyebrows.
desires: To see the world beyond the Reach
secrets: Possesses a silver raven Talisman of Dimensional Anchoring from Ygraine
Secretly uses talisman with his five sons to visit Chateau Mauvesse and the Dark Mirror
npcs.occupation: Owner of brickworks, richest person in Meagre's Reach

known_topics.content: Barhaim strokes his luxuriant beard. 'My brickworks are the lifeblood of Meagre's Reach. We use clay from the Dark Mirror—a gift from Ygraine herself.'
His eyes narrow. 'Redhearth is a fool. His rebellion would destroy everything Ygraine has given us. I will not let that happen.'
Barhaim's voice grows heavy. 'We cannot leave this hex. Those born here who cross the boundary... vanish into oblivion. Ygraine's magic saved us, but it also binds us.'

secret_info.content: Barhaim glances around, then produces a silver raven from his pocket. 'Ygraine gave me this Talisman of Dimensional Anchoring. With it, my sons and I can visit her at Chateau Mauvesse—and the Dark Mirror itself.'
secret_info.hint: He seems to travel freely despite the curse binding other villagers.

secret_info.content: He lowers his voice. 'In the basement of the workers' lodging, I train my workers as a militia. When Redhearth makes his move, we will be ready to defend Ygraine's gift.'
secret_info.hint: Muffled sounds of military drills can be heard from the brickyard basement at night.

relationships.description: Political enemy leading rebel faction against Ygraine's rule
relationships.notes: Barhaim despises Redhearth's rebellion and secretly trains militia to oppose him

relationships.description: The sorceress who saved Meagre's Reach and grants Barhaim special privileges
relationships.notes: Barhaim is utterly loyal to Ygraine and possesses her gift—the Talisman of Dimensional Anchoring

npcs.name: Sister Nancy Delora
npcs.title: Nun
npcs.description: A stony-faced old human nun, dressed in a chaste white robe embroidered with golden doves.
npcs.dress: chaste white robe embroidered with golden doves
desires: To be excluded from contentious goings-on in the village
secrets: Secretly wishes to leave Meagre's Reach and go on pilgrimage to Castle Brackenwold, but knows this is an impossibility
Vicar Hallyman left and disappeared into oblivion
npcs.occupation: Nun, serves as assistant to absent Vicar Hallyman, takes confession and holds services

known_topics.content: Sister Delora speaks with frosty precision. 'I tend to the Chapel of the Host of Heaven's Light. The Vicar is... away. I take confession and hold services in his stead.'
She sighs wearily. 'The squabbles between Barhaim and Redhearth are of no concern to me. I wish only to be left in peace to serve the Host of Heaven.'
Her eyes soften slightly. 'The wooden idol of St Lillibeth of the Sugared Breath stands upon our altar. Those who pray sincerely may receive her blessing—the gift of Lesser Healing.'

secret_info.content: Her stony facade cracks. 'I dream of walking the roads to Castle Brackenwold, of seeing the great churches beyond this place. But I know it is impossible. The curse would take me, as it took...' She falls silent.
secret_info.hint: Her eyes grow distant when travelers mention other holy sites.

secret_info.content: Sister Delora's voice becomes a whisper. 'Vicar Halleman tried to leave Meagre's Reach. He stepped beyond the hex boundary and... vanished. Into oblivion. That is why I remain here, tending to my duties.'
secret_info.hint: She never speaks of the Vicar in the present tense.

relationships.description: The sage often visits the chapel for prayer and contemplation
relationships.notes: 2-in-6 chance of encountering Lorrima Gravesby at the chapel

npcs.name: Benedict Redhearth
npcs.title: Baker / Dissident Leader
npcs.description: A hale old human man of 140 years (as an Elder, he was born 340 years ago) with spiky red hair and beard, a distended gut, and fire in his eyes.
npcs.speech: Hoarse tirades and quiet mumbling. Woldish.
desires: To free the people of Meagre's Reach from their bondage under Ygraine's magic
secrets: Secretly believes that ending Ygraine's spell on the village will bring about the death of its inhabitants
Desires above all to return himself and the other Elders to Heaven
Claims to recall his death and the embrace of Heaven but will not speak of details
npcs.occupation: Village baker and leader of rebel faction

known_topics.content: Redhearth barely looks up from his furious shoveling. 'Cookies. Spiced bread. Two silver a ration. Buy or leave—I've work to do.'
His eyes blaze with fire. 'Ygraine keeps us trapped here like toys in a box! We Elders were dead—at peace in Heaven—until she dragged us back. This is no life, it is imprisonment!'
He slams a loaf onto the counter. 'Those born in the Reach cannot leave hex 1703. Step beyond, and you vanish. Ygraine's so-called gift comes with chains invisible.'

secret_info.content: Redhearth's voice drops to a hoarse whisper. 'I know that breaking Ygraine's spell will likely kill all the Elders—myself included. But that is what I want. We should not be here. We belong in Heaven, where we were before she stole us back.'
secret_info.hint: His rebellion seems less about freedom and more about something darker—a desire for finality.

secret_info.content: His eyes grow distant. 'I remember dying. I remember the embrace of Heaven—warmth, light, peace beyond description. And then Ygraine's magic ripped me back into this cursed flesh. I cannot speak of what I saw, but I know where we belong.'
secret_info.hint: He speaks of death with longing rather than fear.

relationships.description: Political enemy who opposes the rebellion and remains loyal to Ygraine
relationships.notes: Quarrels with Barhaim loudly in the village square

relationships.description: The nun who expels him from church for being a malcontent
relationships.notes: Sister Delora has loudly expelled Redhearth from the church

npcs.name: Primulus Paste
npcs.title: Grizzle and Grouse Proprietor
npcs.description: A rotund, sour-faced, slack-jowled human man in his middle years (a Youngling), with a dirty mop of blond hair and drooping moustaches like a pair of rat tails.
npcs.dress: grubby hose and shirts, splitting at the seams
desires: To marry his eldest daughter, Pilphra (24), to any well-off outsider willing to settle in the Reach

known_topics.content: Paste grumbles as he wipes down the bar. 'Food and lodging at standard rates. Try the stoggy stew—fermented game fowl on beans. Three silver a plate. Local specialty.'
His sour face brightens slightly. 'My eldest daughter Pilphra is 24, unmarried, and looking for a well-off husband. Anyone willing to settle in the Reach would do well to consider her.'
He shrugs dismissively. 'Barhaim and Redhearth can fight all they want. I just want to run my inn in peace and see my daughter married.'

relationships.description: Redhearth's Rebels regularly meet in a shadowed corner of the Grizzle and Grouse
relationships.notes: Paste tolerates the rebels but doesn't actively support them

npcs.name: Lorrima Gravesby
npcs.title: Sage (Level 4 Cleric)
npcs.description: An elderly human woman of graceful bearing, with long silver hair and deep grey eyes.
npcs.dress: plain white robes, with an ornate, swan-crested silver helm (a Helm of Realignment—she was formerly Lawful)
npcs.speech: Slow and soft. Woldish, Old Woldish, Liturgic.
secrets: Unbeknown to any in Meagre's Reach, Gravesby is a former cleric of the Order of St Signis and retains the capabilities of that Class
npcs.occupation: Sage specializing in monster lore, retired from Castle Brackenwold

known_topics.content: Gravesby speaks slowly and softly. 'I am a sage of monster lore. Bring me your questions about beasts and creatures—or better yet, specimens. Whole carcasses or parts, I accept them all.'

She gestures to the tower around her. 'Smarg's Turret has been my home for many years. The cellars contain my collection—jarred and stuffed specimens of fairies, monsters, and fantastic beasts. The origin of the turret itself is unclear, even to the Elders.'
Three spectral hounds pad silently through the tower. 'Benester, Eggort, and Hollyhock—my lichhounds. Faithful companions in my studies.'

secret_info.content: She removes her ornate, swan-crested silver helm briefly. 'This is a Helm of Realignment. I was once a cleric of the Order of St Signis—Lawful in alignment and devoted to destroying the undead. The helm... changed me. Now I am Neutral, but I retain my clerical capabilities.'
secret_info.hint: She wears an unusual helm and has undead companions—strange for a monster-lore sage.

secret_info.content: In the library on the second floor, a silver Holy Shield bearing the symbol of St Signis hangs upon the wall. 'A relic of my former life. I keep it... as a reminder.'
secret_info.hint: A holy symbol of St Signis can be glimpsed in her library.

relationships.description: Sometimes visits the chapel for private prayer and contemplation
relationships.notes: 2-in-6 chance of being found in prayer at the chapel

entries.description: 1d3 Elders gathered in the village square, cleaning the Frozen with soapy cloths.
12 immigrant brickworkers roll into the village with cartload of iridescent clay from the Dark Mirror.
Panic in the village as a fire breaks out in the brickyard.
Benedict Redhearth and Reynold Barhaim quarrel loudly in the village square.
A woman tearfully asking if any have seen her husband, Jock, who has not returned from hunting.
Sister Delora loudly expels Benedict Redhearth from the church, stating that malcontents are unwelcome at her services.
A scuffle between 2d6 Redhearth's Rebels and a like number of Loyalist brickworkers.
An adventuring party carries the bloody, decapitated head of a bestial centaur to Smarg's Turret.
Benedict Redhearth drunkenly rages through the village, urging all Reach-folk to take up arms and storm Chateau Mauvesse.
A drunk claims the Frozen have returned to life.
A sombre procession through Everslumber Lane, bearing the bones of honoured ancestors.
All-night festivities at the Grizzle and Grouse, as the landlord attempts to find a suitor for his daughter.

monsters.name: Lichhound
monsters.description: Three lichhounds named Benester, Eggort, and Hollyhock reside in Smarg's Turret with the sage
